In this problem we will compute a z-score.

```{r equation, echo=FALSE}
x<-params$x; 
mu<-params$mu; 
numer<-(x-mu); 
sigma<-params$sigma; 
z<-(x-mu)/sigma
```

Suppose that $\mu=`r mu`$, $\sigma=`r sigma`$ and $x = `r x`$.  
Then we can find the value of z as follows:

$$ 
z=\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}
 =\frac{`r x`-`r mu`}{`r sigma`}
 =\frac{`r numer`}{`r sigma`}
 =`r z` 
$$
